image.altText: A plume of sediment over a coastline with cliffs in the background.

props.synopsis: The EPA says a layer of clay was unexpectedly uncovered during works to raise a seawall south of Adelaide, which released a sediment plume into the water.

title.children: Sediment plume interrupts Christies Beach seawall works

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: The father of a deceased newborn baby at the centre of a criminal neglect case told police in a recorded interview he had accidentally knocked over a bassinet.

title.children: Newborn had injuries consistent with 'high-impact car crash', court hears

image.altText: Young girl smiling and painting

props.synopsis: When Jung Yoon moved to Australia from South Korea in 1995, she had never encountered a person with a disability before, but that changed when she had her daughter Joanne. Now she is dedicating her life to help people with cognitive disability have better employment opportunities.

title.children: Inclusive hiring at the heart of project for people with cognitive impairment

image.altText: A drone shot of the Whyalla pellet plant.

props.synopsis: Energy and Mining Minister Tom Koutsantonis says iron mining job losses linked to GFG's Whyalla steelworks 'could have been avoided'.

title.children: SA Energy Minister slams GFG over 350 iron mining job losses

image.altText: The cycling path along Adelaide's Southern Expressway.

props.synopsis: A South Australian teen has appeared in court after allegedly stringing fencing wire on a bike path — but he says he's innocent.

title.children: Teen denies twice setting wire traps on bike path despite alleged video

image.altText: A mouth in the background of a bunch of coriander.

props.synopsis: Some people in the food science world believe tastebuds can be retrained to enjoy divisive foods such as broccoli, brussels sprouts and coriander.

title.children: How you can retrain your tastebuds to like food you detest

image.altText: Several people sit at outdoor tables in front of a white brick building in a plaza.

props.synopsis: Weekend and public holiday surcharges are becoming commonplace for many businesses. In a cost-of-living crisis, what do consumers think, and what are the rules?

title.children: Have you ever paid a public holiday or weekend surcharge? Here are the rules

image.altText: Woman and man leave Elizabeth Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: A 55-year-old woman who was allegedly driving the car that hit and killed a woman in Adelaide's north in the early hours of Tuesday morning has been released on bail.

title.children: Alleged hit-and-run driver released on bail after crash in Adelaide's north

image.altText: a stop sign at the level crossing

props.synopsis: More than 18,000 level crossings in Australia have little more than a stop sign to warn drivers to look out for freight trains hurtling towards them in the dark. A campaign is calling for a mandatory lighting solution.

title.children: 'It doesn't pass the pub test': Inside the debate to put mandatory lighting on trains

image.altText: A close up image of Kevin Rudd with his hand on his chin.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese confirms his ambassador to the United States, Kevin Rudd, has made direct contact with US president-elect Donald Trump, saying he is confident Mr Rudd can succeed under the Trump administration.

title.children: Kevin Rudd and Donald Trump have made direct contact, PM confirms

image.altText: Mother charged infant

props.synopsis: The 34-year-old, who allegedly poisoned her daughter and recorded her physical and emotional suffering to elicit donations, appeared in court today.

title.children: Lawyer for influencer accused of torturing baby asks for protective custody

image.altText: Jacob Vadakkedathu, Peter Dutton

props.synopsis: The Liberals lead Senate candidate for Canberra faces a vote to be disendorsed after being called in for a meeting over claims of branch stacking.

title.children: Liberal Senate candidate faces vote to be disendorsed

image.altText: Gavin Newsom dressed in a hat, sunglasses and a jacket walks on a road. A plume of smoke extends over the sky in the background.

props.synopsis: As blazes continue to ravage parts of California, the heir apparent of the Democratic Party has found himself at the centre of a political firestorm stoked by rival Republicans and Donald Trump.

title.children: 'He is the boss': For all the alleged failures across LA, one man was in charge

image.altText: SpaceX Starship on launch pad

props.synopsis: A SpaceX prototype has failed in space after its launch caused weeks of Qantas flight delays.

title.children: SpaceX prototype fails in space after launch caused string of Qantas delays

image.altText: The storm cell over Carina, taken from Greenslopes on Thursday.

props.synopsis: An "unusual" microburst hit parts of Brisbane on Thursday, uprooting trees, damaging property and cutting power to 25,000 homes.

title.children: What is a 'microburst' and why do they occur?

image.altText: A portrait photo of Katie Tangey, who is smiling, against a colourful floral background.

props.synopsis: The mother of a Melbourne woman killed in a "despicable" arson attack in Melbourne's west on Thursday remembers her 27-year-old daughter as a "beautiful soul".

title.children: Mother pays tribute to Melbourne arson attack victim Katie Tangey

image.altText: The Chinese national flag is flown in front of an office building.

props.synopsis: New data shows China's economy grew 5.4 per cent annually in the fourth quarter, beating market expectations. Meanwhile a survey by UBS reveals the reach of the "bank of mum and dad", with 40 per cent of respondents giving or receiving cash last year. This is how the day unfolded.

title.children: China's economy beats expectations but ASX turns negative — as it happened

image.altText: David Lynch appearing on the runway of the Cannes Film Festival.

props.synopsis: The acclaimed filmmaker, who directed Blue Velvet, The Elephant Man and Mulholland Drive, dies aged 78.

title.children: 'A singular genius': Peers pay tribute to filmmaker David Lynch

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Donald Trump is sworn in as the 45th president of the United States

props.synopsis: Donald Trump won the US presidential election in November last year, but he's not officially the president yet. Here's what to expect from his inauguration.

title.children: Who's on the guest list for Trump's inauguration?

image.altText: A close up of a smiling Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds

props.synopsis: The actor and director had already launched a lawsuit against New York Times, claiming the paper worked with Lively to destroy his reputation.

title.children: Justin Baldoni sues It Ends With Us co-star Blake Lively

image.altText: Four men stand side by side smiling on front of a green door

props.synopsis: With new frontman Frank Carter, the band will play their iconic debut album Never Mind The Bollocks in full across Australia this April.

title.children: For the first time in decades, punk legends Sex Pistols will tour Australia

image.altText: Ash Gardner smiles and holds her bat and helmet up after reaching a century

props.synopsis: Australia is one win away from retaining the Women's Ashes after completing a thumping 86-run win over England in the third ODI in Hobart.

title.children: Gardner ton and classic catch put Australia one step away from Women's Ashes

image.altText: Young woman selfie in the Australian bush

props.synopsis: Alexandra Paton, who researches how to manage feral cat populations, says her PhD is important for Australia's wildlife but her income is lower than what she earned as a teenager at Macca's.

title.children: Alex loves doing her PhD, but says she's earning under the minimum wage

image.altText: IMAGE Stallone, Voight, Gibson composite

props.synopsis: President-elect Donald Trump has tapped Sylvester Stallone, Mel Gibson and Jon Voight to be his "eyes and ears" in Hollywood.

title.children: Trump names trio of action stars as Hollywood 'special ambassadors'

image.altText: Tourists flocking at a train station in Japan

props.synopsis: Nearly 1 million Australians visited Japan last year, up more than 300,000 from 2023.

title.children: Australians are loving Japan so much they're calling it the 'new Bali'

image.altText: Marles navy pointing

props.synopsis: A new budgetary report said it would be 'difficult and expensive' to sell Virginia class submarines to Australia without compromising the US Navy.

title.children: US congressional analysis blunt on AUKUS difficulties

image.altText: People work at desks in an airy room, sitting in front of computers.

props.synopsis: A recent WA court ruling sets the bar for how far businesses need to go to protect themselves against cyber criminals, according to experts, but the good news is it isn't hard to meet.

title.children: Expert reveals antidote for invoice scams after WA court ruling

image.altText: A man looking at the night sky through binoculars

props.synopsis: The night sky is putting on a celestial show with a dazzling "planetary parade" featuring six major planets and a bonus comet.

title.children: Six planets and a bonus comet set to light up the night sky this weekend. Here's how to spot them

image.altText: Woman checking her wrinkles on her forehead

props.synopsis: Wrinkle patches have been touted as a cheap and accessible way to reduce creases and fine lines, but can they actually do that? Here's what two dermatologists say.

title.children: Dermatologists give their verdicts on wrinkle patches

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios waves to the crowd

props.synopsis: Have you been paying attention to the news this week? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: The LA fires, Nick Kyrgios and two new baby giraffes

image.altText: Rosemary Hannah, an older woman in blue pants and a pink shirt, stands at a balcony overlooking a garden

props.synopsis: More Mallacoota residents left homeless after the 2019-2020 bushfires finally have a place to call their own.

title.children: Victorian Black Summer survivors breathe 'sigh of relief' as new homes open

image.altText: Luke Gourlay being hugged by an anonymous friend, with a tattoo on his right upper arm visible

props.synopsis: Sunshine Coast man Luke Gourlay's mother and grandmother are desperately searching for clues to explain his disappearance more than a year ago.

title.children: Family hunts for answers after 29yo's 'strange' Boxing Day disappearance

image.altText: Ralph Fiennes in catholic cardinal robes in red and gold, while other cardinals mill behind him

props.synopsis: While the Vatican's sacred traditions and time-honoured rituals are elevated to their most beautiful heights, the politicking of the world's so-called holiest men in Conclave isn't far removed from the Roy siblings' scheming in Succession.

title.children: The election of a new pope is dramatic, brutal and sometimes absurd in Conclave
